title: Liverpool midfielder set for new long term contract with Reds [Sky Sports]
text:
Liverpool midfielder set for new long term contract with Reds [Sky Sports] By Rebecca Knight   Key man 
There’s some good news for Liverpool after a hard 2017, as the news that Adam Lallana has agreed to sign a new three year contract with the club has emerged. 
There have long been rumours that this was set to happen, with Jurgen Klopp intent on keeping his best players at the club – and that meant securing the future of Lallana. 
Right on the heels of Philippe Coutinho’s extended deal, Lallana will see a three year deal now tying him to the Reds. Building for the future 
Klopp is known for spending seven years at clubs to build his project – and then looking to move on, and it seems that could well be the case on Merseyside. 
So far, he’s done excellent work – but he’s only had a certain amount of time and money to really build his vision. This summer , that is likely to change, with the back line in serious need of rebooting – something Klopp and the fans have alluded to on more than one occasion. 
A left back and a goalkeeper seem to be a top priority, and even the staunchest of Dejan Lovren fans would probably admit he’s not world class, and Matip deserves a better partner alongside him. Winner Betting Odds
